title: Happy Hour: Don’t Fret
author: Christy Frink
excerpt: Gibson Guitars is safe from the illegal wood auditors… for now. [WPLN] The latest food security study has found that 13.5% of all Tennessee households–or 2.5 million families–are considered food-insecure, which means that they’re not sure how they will feed themselves. [WKRN] If taking the bus from Williamson County to Nashville is something that appeals to you, that service will be starting up December 1. contentEncoded:
• Gibson Guitars is safe from the illegal wood auditors… for now. [WPLN]
  • The latest food security study has found that 13.5% of all Tennessee households–or 2.5 million families–are considered food-insecure, which means that they’re not sure how they will feed themselves. [WKRN]
  • If taking the bus from Williamson County to Nashville is something that appeals to you, that service will be starting up December 1. [Tennessean]
  • For better or for worse, the controversial move of the West Precinct crime lab is happening. [WSMV]
  • Speaking of controversial things, state legislators approved the switchgrass biofuel project that everyone was freaking out about a few weeks ago. [Tennessean]
  • And, Sarah Palin will soon be gracing our city with her presence. [WSMV]

Photo by cdumo.
